symptomDuration.title: When did you have this symptom? (Check all that apply)

enumNames: Was one of my first symptoms
Occurred when I was at my worst
Occurred even after I started to feel much better

symptoms_start.title: 1. When did you first notice symptoms related to COVID-19?

symptoms_worst.title: 2. When did you feel your symptoms were at their worst?

symptoms_recovery.title: 3. When did you feel your symptoms were getting much better?

symptoms_recovery_date.title: I started to feel much better on:

symptoms_none.title: 4. When did you feel you no longer had symptoms?

symptoms_none_date.title: My last day of any symptoms was:

symptoms_list.title: 5. Please describe your symptoms (check all that apply):

loss_of_smell.title: Partial or complete loss of smell

loss_of_taste.title: Partial or complete loss of taste

paralysis.title: Inability to move part of your body (paralysis)

fever_highest.title: What was the highest temperature?(° F)

kind_of_testing.title: 6. What kind of COVID-19 testing have you had?

no_test.title: I was not tested, but I had suspected COVID-19

no_test_no_symptoms.title: I was not tested and had no symptoms

how_was_it_treated.title: 7. How was your COVID-19 treated? (pick single response reflecting your most intensive level of care)
enumNames: My COVID-19 was managed at home
I was seen in a doctor's office, clinic, or screening tent, and I was sent home
I was seen in the emergency room, and I was sent home
I was admitted to the hospital
I was in the intensive care unit

hospitals.title: 7a. Please indicate any of the hospitals at which you were treated for COVID-19. (check all that apply)

enum: New York City Health and Hospital
enumNames: New York City Health and Hospital

hospitalization_treatment.title: 7b. If you were hospitalized, did you have the following? (check all that apply)

oxigen.title: Oxygen through prongs in your nose

oxigen_mask.title: Oxygen mask, BIPAP, or CPAP (mask on the face to help you breathe)

kidney_dialysis.title: Kidney problems requiring dialysis of any kind

blood_clots.title: Blood clots in legs or lungs

septic_shock.title: Septic shock requiring blood pressure support with pressor medicines given through an IV

hospitals_other.title: If you were treated in a different hospital, what was its name?

smoking.title: 10. Do you smoke?
enum: I used to smoke, but I quit
enumNames: I used to smoke, but I quit

vaping.title: 11. Do you vape?
enum: I used to vape, but I quit
enumNames: I used to vape, but I quit

alcohol.title: 12. How often do you consume alcoholic beverages?
enum: Once a month or less often
4 times a week or more often
enumNames: Once a month or less often
4 times a week or more often

smoking_how_many_cigarettes.title: 10a. How many cigarettes on average do you smoke per day?

enum: I used to smoke, but I quit

anxiety.title: 13. Over the past week, how often have you been feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge?

worry.title: 14. Over the past week, how often have you not been able to stop worrying?

loneliness.title: 15. Many people may also feel loneliness during this time. How often have you felt lonely during the past week?

regular_medications.title: 8. Which of the following medications were you taking on a regular basis before you got sick with COVID-19? (check all that apply)

enum: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory agents or NSAIDS (aspirin, celecoxib, diclofenac, Cambia, Cataflam, Voltaren, diflunisal, etodolac, ibuprofen, Motrin, Advil, indomethacin, Indocin, ketoprofen, ketorolac, nambumetone, naproxen, Aleve, Anaprox, Naprelan, Naprosyn, oxaprozin, Daypro,  piroxicam, Feldene, salsalate, Disalate, sulidnac, tolmetin)
Tylenol, Acetaminophen, Daquil, Nyquil, Excedrin, Sinutab
Inhaled corticosteroids (Advair, beclomethasone, budesonide, ciclesonide, flunisolide, fluticasone, or mometasone)
Oral or injected steroids (prednisone, methylprednisolone, dexamethasone, hydrocortisone)
High blood pressure medication- ACE inhibitors (Benazepril, Captopril, Fosinopril, Lisinpril)
High blood pressure medication-angiotensin receptor blockers (Edarbi, Atacand, Eprosartan, Avapro)
High blood pressure medication- beta blockers (metoprolol, atenolol, tramadol)
Cholesterol lowering statins (such as atorvastatin or simvastatin)
Blood thinning medications (Eliquis, Xarelto, Coumadin, Warfarin)
Antiplatelet medications to prevent a heart attack or stroke (clopidogrel, Plavix, prasugrel, ticagrelor, cilostazol)
Pill to dampen the immune system (azathioprine)
Injectable medication to dampen the immune system (Enbrel, humira, actemra, anakinra, Xolair, dupixent)
IV medications for immune conditions (infliximab/Remicade, rituximab, abatacept/Orencia, and belimumab/Benlysta
Medications after organ transplant (tacrolimus, cyclosporin, Mycophenolate)
HIV medication (lopinavir/ritonavir, darunavir/ritonavir, tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF), tenofovir alafenamide fumarate (TAF), and combination medications containing these agents)
enumNames: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory agents or NSAIDS (aspirin, celecoxib, diclofenac, Cambia, Cataflam, Voltaren, diflunisal, etodolac, ibuprofen, Motrin, Advil, indomethacin, Indocin, ketoprofen, ketorolac, nambumetone, naproxen, Aleve, Anaprox, Naprelan, Naprosyn, oxaprozin, Daypro,  piroxicam, Feldene, salsalate, Disalate, sulidnac, tolmetin)

Cholesterol lowering statins (such as atorvastatin or simvastatin)
Blood thinning medications (Eliquis, Xarelto, Coumadin, Warfarin)
Antiplatelet medications to prevent a heart attack or stroke (clopidogrel, Plavix, prasugrel, ticagrelor, cilostazol)
Pill to dampen the immune system (azathioprine)
Injectable medication to dampen the immune system (Enbrel, humira, actemra, anakinra, Xolair, dupixent)
IV medications for immune conditions (infliximab/Remicade, rituximab, abatacept/Orencia, and belimumab/Benlysta
Medications after organ transplant (tacrolimus, cyclosporin, Mycophenolate)
HIV medication (lopinavir/ritonavir, darunavir/ritonavir, tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF), tenofovir alafenamide fumarate (TAF), and combination medications containing these agents)

covid_medications.title: 9. Which of the following medications did you take/were you given to treat your COVID-19 illness? (check all that apply):

enum: NSAIDs (ibuprofen, aspirin, naproxen, celecoxib, diclofenac, indomethacin, piroxicam)
enumNames: NSAIDs (ibuprofen, aspirin, naproxen, celecoxib, diclofenac, indomethacin, piroxicam)

hydroxychloroquine_side_effects.title: 9a. If you were treated with hydroxychloroquine (Plaquenil), please describe if you experienced any of the following? (check all that apply):

enum: Loss of sensation in hands or feet
Loss of consciousness or passing out
Hearing or seeing things that do not exist
enumNames: Loss of sensation in hands or feet
Loss of consciousness or passing out
Hearing or seeing things that do not exist
